title: Heat Stroke
summary: Life-threatening condition when body temperature rises above 104째F (40째C). Requires immediate cooling and emergency medical care.

steps.title: Recognize Heat Stroke
steps.description: High body temperature (104째F+), altered mental state or confusion, hot dry skin OR profuse sweating, rapid strong pulse, throbbing headache, nausea. This is a medical emergency - call 911 immediately.

steps.title: Move to Cool Area
steps.description: Move person to air-conditioned area or shade immediately. Remove unnecessary clothing. Begin cooling while waiting for ambulance. Every minute counts to prevent organ damage.

steps.title: Cool Rapidly
steps.description: Immerse in cool water if possible, or spray with water and fan vigorously. Apply ice packs to neck, armpits, and groin. Continue cooling efforts until emergency services arrive.

steps.title: Monitor Vital Signs
steps.description: If conscious, give cool water to sip. Monitor breathing and consciousness. If person vomits, turn on side. Be prepared to perform CPR if needed. Do not give fever-reducing medications.

steps.title: Continue Cooling
steps.description: Continue aggressive cooling until body temperature drops to 101-102째F or emergency services arrive. Person may shiver - this is normal. Stay with them and keep cooling.

warnings: Heat stroke can cause permanent organ damage or death within minutes
Do NOT give fever medications like aspirin or acetaminophen
Person may have seizures - protect from injury but don't restrain
whenToSeekHelp: Call 911 immediately for all suspected heat stroke
This is always a medical emergency requiring hospital care
Do not attempt to drive person yourself - they need ambulance care
preventionTips: Never leave anyone in a parked car
Avoid strenuous activity during hottest parts of day
Stay hydrated and take cooling breaks in hot weather
